# getbased

> Free, open-source blood work dashboard that runs entirely in your browser.
> Import any lab PDF with AI, track biomarker trends over time, and get
> AI-powered interpretations. No account required. Your data never leaves
> your device.

## What getbased does

- Import any blood work PDF — AI extracts all markers automatically
- Track trends over time with interactive charts across 16+ biomarker categories
- Specialty labs supported: OAT (organic acids) and more via custom marker pipeline
- AI chat panel with debate mode — pit two AI personas against each other over your results
- 9 lifestyle context cards (diet, exercise, sleep, stress, etc.) shape AI interpretation
- Menstrual cycle tracking with phase-aware reference ranges
- Correlation viewer, heatmaps, trend alerts, PDF reports
- Fully local-first — all data stored in browser localStorage, encrypted at rest (AES-256-GCM)
- Works with OpenRouter (200+ models), Anthropic, Venice, or local Ollama

## Key pages

- [Landing page](https://getbased.health/): Feature overview and getting started
- [Web app](https://app.getbased.health): Launch the dashboard (no install needed)
- [Documentation](https://app.getbased.health/docs): User guides, setup, and feature walkthroughs
- [Blog](https://getbased.health/blog): Development stories and health data insights
- [GitHub](https://github.com/elkimek/get-based): Source code (GPLv3 license)
- [Discord](https://discord.gg/zJdVB9zgQB): Community and support

## Docs highlights

- [Getting started](https://app.getbased.health/docs/getting-started): First import walkthrough
- [AI setup guide](https://app.getbased.health/docs/ai-setup): Configure OpenRouter, Anthropic, Venice, or Ollama
- [Specialty labs](https://app.getbased.health/docs/specialty-labs): Importing OAT and other specialty tests
- [Privacy and security](https://app.getbased.health/docs/privacy): Local-first architecture, encryption, PII obfuscation
- [Changelog](https://app.getbased.health/docs/changelog): Version history and updates
